intro: Hieracium calymmotum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium calymmotum is an herbaceous perennial that produces achenes as its seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
